reg32.name: INTR
reg32.doc: Shows currently pending interrupts. Write 1 to a bit to reset it, and ACK the interrupt.

bitfield.name: NOTIFY
bitfield.doc: You asked for a NOTIFY with interrupt and got it.

bitfield.name: QUERY
bitfield.doc: You asked for a QUERY with interrupt and got it.

bitfield.name: ILLEGAL_MTHD
bitfield.doc: You tried to use a method that doesn't exist on this class.

bitfield.name: ILLEGAL_CLASS
bitfield.doc: You tried to use a class not supported by this GPU.

bitfield.name: DOUBLE_NOTIFY
bitfield.doc: You tried to use NOTIFY command on another NOTIFY command.

bitfield.name: FIRMWARE_MTHD
bitfield.doc: You ran one of the FIRMWARE methods.

bitfield.name: BUFFER_NOTIFY
bitfield.doc: You asked for m2mf transfer with interrupt after finish and got it.

bitfield.name: DATA_ERROR
bitfield.doc: You used an invalid parameter for this method. Or maybe you tried to launch some operation, but the relevant state is inconsistent. Relevant state is in DATA_ERROR

bitfield.name: TRAP
bitfield.doc: A PGRAPH command failed in the middle of execution. TRAP register will tell you which subunit reports the trap.

reg32.name: TRAP
reg32.doc: Like INTR, but applies to TRAP sub-types. Shows which subunits report trap. Each subunit has its own TRAP status register, which you have to check in turn to know the exact TRAP sub-subtype, and reset it. Write 1 to a bit to reset it and ACK the trap.

reg32.name: DATA_ERROR
reg32.doc: Stores type of the pending DATA_ERROR.

reg32.name: TRAP_EN
reg32.doc: A bitmask of events that will cause traps, same bit assignments as in TRAP reg.

reg32.name: INTR_EN
reg32.doc: A bitmask of events that will cause interrupts, same bit assignments as in INTR reg.

reg32.name: INTR_DISPATCH_CTXCTL_DOWN
reg32.doc: If a bit is set to 1, a given interrupt will use _CTXCTL_DOWN versions of interrupt registers and will be routed to main CTXCTL interrupt source 11 [HUB_CTXCTL_DOWN] instead of host PGRAPH interrupt.

reg32.name: INTR_CTXCTL_DOWN
reg32.doc: Like INTR, but for CTXCTL interrupts.

reg32.name: INTR_EN_CTXCTL_DOWN
reg32.doc: Like INTR_EN, but for CTXCTL interrupts.

bitfield.name: PULL
bitfield.doc: Enables executing commands incoming through DISPATCH_CMD.

bitfield.name: LIMIT
bitfield.doc: Max number of slots allowed to be occupied in FIFO. 0 and > 0x100 are treated as 0x100.

bitfield.name: OCCUPIED
bitfield.doc: How many slots contain valid data atm.

reg32.name: TRAPPED_ADDR
reg32.doc: Offending subchan + method, for [most types of] PGRAPH interrupts.

reg32.name: TRAPPED_DATA_LOW
reg32.doc: Offending method data, for [most types of] PGRAPH interrupts.

reg32.name: UNK00
reg32.doc: Affects the maximum number of MPs used for compute shader grids. This includes layout the layout of the TEMP area. Values seen: 0x201 for 1 GPC with 2 TPs and 0x804 for 4 GPCs with 2 TPs each.

reg32.name: TRAP
reg32.doc: This reports compute program launch check errors (in the "launch descriptor") on a0c0.

bitfield.name: BAR_0
bitfield.doc: When BAR has all bits from BAR_REQMASK[0]&BAR_REQMASK[1] set.

reg32.name: INTR_ROUTE
reg32.doc: Indexed falcon register, in 8 copies. Index i determines the source of falcon interrupt i+8.

reg32.name: TFB_UNFUCKUP_OFFSET_QUERIES
reg32.doc: If set to 0, the 9097/1b0c/0d005002 query will return bytes written since the last time TFB_BUFFER_OFFSET (9097/0390) was written. Set it to 1 to make it return the full/absolute offset, which is required for a sane implementation of transform feedback. (Setting only on GPC[0].TP[0] seems enough.)

reg32.name: INTR_UP_ROUTE
reg32.doc: Indexed falcon register, in 19 copies. Index i determines the source of interrupt i. Source for interrupt 19 is hardwired to 0x2b [WATCHDOG].
